intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. fontanesii, commonly known as the Armenian caraway, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small white flowers bloom in summer, followed by small, oval fruits that are used in traditional medicine. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf structure and geographic distribution.
